title: Letters of Credit
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20150129011056/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Publications](http://web.archive.org/web/20150129011056/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Publications) : Letters of Credit**  
By [Walter Tracy](http://web.archive.org/web/20150129011056/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Walter%20Tracy).  
First published in 1986.  
 [Buy it](http://web.archive.org/web/20150129011056/http:/www.amazon.com/dp/1567922406/typophile-20)

By no means complete, it is still one of the best books that analyzes typefaces and type design.

The first half of the book deals with type measurement, legibility & readibility, type making from metal to film to 1980's technology, many aspects of proportion and letterforms.

The second half looks at Designers of Type: [Jan van Krimpen](http://web.archive.org/web/20150129011056/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jan%20van%20Krimpen), [Frederic W. Goudy](http://web.archive.org/web/20150129011056/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Frederic%20W.%20Goudy), [Rudolf Koch](http://web.archive.org/web/20150129011056/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rudolf%20Koch), [W.A. Dwiggins](http://web.archive.org/web/20150129011056/http:/typophile.com/wiki/W.A.%20Dwiggins) and [Stanley Morison](http://web.archive.org/web/20150129011056/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Stanley%20Morison).
author: paul d hunt
